Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Plantaricyclin A (XXC, natural AMPs;class 2c circular bacteriocin; UCBB1aA; Gram-positive bacteria, prokaryotes)

Literature.Author: Borrero J, Kelly E, O'Connor PM, Kelleher P, Scully C, Cotter PD, Mahony J, van Sinderen D.2017
Literature.Reference: Appl Environ Microbiol. 2017 Dec 15;84(1). pii: e01801-17. In press.PubMed
Literature.Title: Plantaricyclin A, a Novel Circular Bacteriocin Produced by Lactobacillus plantarum NI326: Purification, Characterization, and Heterologous Production.

Sequence Information.Comments: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that the unmodified sequence of this peptide shows 68.8% similarity toAcidocin B.Activity: Active against A. acidoterrestris sp1, L. lactis HP, L. lactis KH, L. lactis MG1363, L. lactis RT28, L. lactis NZ9000, L. bulgaricus UCC, and P. inopinatus 1011.Antimicrobial robustness: pH-insensitive: No antimicrobial activity was lost between pH 2 and 10 or from 30 to 100oC for min (heat-stable). However, the antimicrobial activity of PlcA was completely lost in the presence of proteinase K and pronase.
